intro: Pseudoxandra acreana, commonly known as the Peruvian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically range in color from purple to pink. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Pseudoxandra acreana is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its harsh habitat and potential medicinal properties.
